file_content.text: A--attention, prisoners! Republic soldiers have come to rescue you! All cells are being unlocked and opened... now.
Please hurry to the aft hangar bay. A supply transport is available to carry you away from this place at last.
Ahh! Don't shoot, don't shoot! I surrender!
You--you're Republic, right? This is a jailbreak? Please--I'll do whatever you want. Just don't hurt me!
Cooperate, and I'll get you out of here, too.
I won't hurt you.
Oh, thank you! Thank you so much!
The Imperials left a slave in charge of their prison?
You run this place?
I am only trusted with limited functions. Most of the facility is automated.
Follow my orders or I'll put you down--got it?
One wrong move and you die!
Yes! Yes, I understand!
You want me to unlock the prisoner cells? I can do it, it will only take a mo--ahh! General Rakton!
Impressive. Your time from learning about A-77 to storming its command deck was shorter than even my most aggressive estimates.
Estimates? You knew we were coming?
What are you talking about?
Of course. My strategies leave no room for an error of this size. Your soldier's escape was no accident.
Havoc is number one for a reason, Rakton.
That's why we're the best.
That will be coming to an end very soon.
This op was suspicious from the beginning.
I knew it was a trap!
Yet you came anyway. The reward seemed to outweigh the risk.
Using prisoners as bait? You're real scum, Rakton.
A trap--I should've known.
Morality is a matter for peacetime. It has no place in war.
Imperial warships have maneuvered into position around A-77. The facility will be obliterated in a matter of minutes. Goodbye.
The shields are already failing! I have to reroute power....
You want to give me an update here, Major? It feels like someone's shooting at us.
Imperial ships are firing on us. We're working on a way out.
Everything is under control.
The Imps are about to blow this whole place apart!
We're in trouble.
They're going to blow up their own prison? This is insane!
Rakton's here with a fleet of ships! You've gotten us all killed!
You walked me into a trap!
What? No, no! We're too close! We're almost out of here!
I can do it! I can keep the shields up! We can all make it out if I just vent the systems level.
You can't vent the systems level--I'm on the systems level! There are droids everywhere, I'd never make it out--who is this moron?
We'll find a way to get everyone out, don't worry.
It'll be okay, Jaxo.
Is there any other way to get the shields up?
What are our options?
There is no other way. Please forgive me, but we have no other alternative.
I'm in charge of this op, Jaxo. And I'm discussing our options.
Let's see some discipline!
This is crazy. Forget the shields, let's just make a run for the hangar!
Without shields, we could never get the cells open fast enough. All of the prisoners would die.
You've got to get me out of here, Major. I can't die in this place. I can't.
I know this is personal, sir, but... three hundred against one? There's only one right choice, here.
This is never easy. But three hundred against one isn't a choice.
We have no choice. We're clearly compelled to rescue the greatest number of prisoners possible.
There's always a choice. Please--don't do this.
If I may interject, the cost in equipment and training to replace a Special Forces operator exceeds that of the three hundred and fourteen other soldiers imprisoned here.
You see? I'm... more valuable. Please, major.
I don't want to die here either, boss. Make a choice so we can get a move on.
When we enlist as soldiers, we give up our lives to preserve those of others. Our careers are merely journeys to reach that moment of sacrifice.
You're insane. This is insane--you have to get me out of here!
Please. Get me out of here. Take me home.
I have to do what's best for the most people.
The mission comes first.
Forgive me, Jaxo. But this is my only option.
I'm sorry, I can't save you.
Vent the service level. Get the shields back up and the prison cells open ASAP.
Yes, yes! Of course!
But... no. It can't end like this. It can't--
It... worked. Shields are back to ninety percent, but they will not last forever.
You should return to your ship. I'll ensure the prisoners are freed and find their way to the transport.
You've done a good job, here.
Thank you.
I should be thanking you. I never thought I'd leave this place alive.
Don't hang around too long yourself.
Make sure you get out, too.
I will not. Thank you.
Please go, now. We don't have much time.
If any prisoners die, then you die too. Got it?
You'd better get everyone out.
Yes. I understand.
I won't leave you here, Jaxo--I'm on my way!
I'll save you Jaxo.
You--run for the hangar bay and get on the old supply transport. After I rescue Jaxo, she'll fly you out.
Yes, yes--whatever you say!
You killed more than three hundred soldiers, just to save one. I hope you're happy.
This is utterly unconscionable. Preferential treatment is bad enough, but you are costing more than three hundred men and women their lives!
I will engage all speed subroutines at once, Major! Ready to move!
Time's wasting--let's go!
Yuun feels this was an unwise choice, Major. Unwise, and costly.
I can't leave her behind. I just can't.
I'm sorry.
Unbelievable. Lead the way, then.
I suggest you save your apologies for those soldiers' families. Let's go.
Yuun is not the one who requires apologies. Let us go.
Nobody's leaving alive if we don't move out right now.
We don't have time to argue.
Fine, we'll go. But this isn't over.
Agreed. But escaping this prison and escaping the repercussions of your choices are not the same thing.
I'm in charge of this squad--what I say goes.
Who's the CO here?
Yeah. No matter how out of line it is. Let's go.
And what a fine leader you are. Let's move out.
This is accurate. Let us go.
